intro: Rauvolfia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Rauvolfia brasiliensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
